intro: Aidia graeffei, commonly known as the mountain hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the Andes Mountains of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in high-altitude regions, preferring cool and humid conditions. Its leaves are palmately lobed, and it produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds. Aidia graeffei is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is adapted to thrive in well-drained soils.
